section.section:
Subject to paragraphs (2) and (3) of this subsection, a member may retire with a normal service retirement allowance if, on or before the date of retirement, the member:
has at least 25 years of eligibility service;
is at least 62 years old; or
is at least 60 years old and has transferred to the Local Fire and Police System from the Employees' Retirement System.

To retire under this subsection, a member shall complete and submit a written application to the Board of Trustees on the form that the Board of Trustees provides stating the date when the member desires to retire.
A member may not retire before the first day of the month after employment ends.

text.section:
Except as provided in subsections (c) and (d) of this section, on retirement under this section, a member is entitled to receive a normal service retirement allowance that equals the number of years of the member's creditable service multiplied by:
1% of the member's average final compensation that is not in excess of the Social Security integration level; and
1.5% of the member's average final compensation that exceeds the Social Security integration level.

section.section:
This subsection applies to a member:
who has not transferred from the Employees' Retirement System; and
whose employer does not contribute to Social Security.

On retirement under this section, a member is entitled to receive a normal service retirement allowance that equals the number of years of the member's creditable service multiplied by 1.5% of the member's average final compensation.
This subsection applies to a member who has transferred from the Employees' Retirement System.

On retirement under this section, a member is entitled to receive a normal service retirement allowance that equals:
2% of the member's average final compensation multiplied by each year of the member's first 30 years of creditable service; and
1% of the member's average final compensation multiplied by each year of creditable service in excess of 30 years.
